text.text:
BRIDGE Discovery Survey

Welcome to the BRIDGE Discovery end-of-project questionnaire !

Notes
- Filling in the questionnaire takes approx. 15 minutes.
- You can interrupt the survey at any time and resume it later. Click on the "Save interview" button to have your information saved before you interrupt the questionnaire.
- You can scroll back and forth as you wish.

Deadline
Please complete the questionnaire as soon as possible but latest by {{member.DatumE}}.

Contact
If you have any questions, please contact Christian Brunner, Head of BRIDGE (christian.brunner@bridge.ch) or Adrian Berwert, Head of impact analysis, Innosuisse (adrian.berwert@innosuisse.ch).

Thank you for your valuable cooperation!
Information from application
Title of BRIDGE Discovery project (as in application)
Funded by the Swiss National Science Foundation (SNSF)
Yes, SNSF National Centres of Competence in Research (NCCR)

placeholder.text: Please specify the SNSF instrument here.

text.text: Has the project idea been the subject of SNSF funding before project submission?
Motivation and strategic importance

Research themes
Developing basic research topics
Academic qualifications (Master, PhD, Postdoc) and strengthening of academic careers
Raising third-party funds to finance research

Application themes
Transferring research to the market and into practice
Gathering experience from the business world and practice for use in research
Strengthening cooperation with implementation partner(s) or spin-off
Preparing a follow-up project with an implementation partner
Securing intellectual property / filing patent application
Which of the following mentioned themes were strategically important to you when submitting the project or during the course of the project?
Were other themes strategically important to you <u>when submitting the project</u>?
The innovation pursued by the BRIDGE Discovery project is...

Innovation can be incremental or radical in nature.
Please indicate which applies to the innovation you pursued with your
BRIDGE Discovery project.

hintText.text:
Remarks: 
Incremental innovations are further developments and optimisations of existing products, services, processes, etc. that are partly substantially new, but do not impact markets and industries in a substantial way. They aim to enhance various aspects of a product or process, such as its efficiency, quality, performance, or user experience.
Radical innovations on the other hand, concern substantially novel products, services, and processes resulting in business models that have a substantial impact on markets and industries. Radical innovations often fundamentally disrupt or even render existing solutions obsolete.

text.text:
Basic research
TRL/SRL 1 - Observation and description of the basic principle of a technology and/or a function or an application. Basic research is recorded and presented.
TRL/SRL 2 - Technology and/or application concept formulated (identification of possible applications). Description of the application.

Application oriented research / Applied research / Experimental development
TRL/SRL 3 - Experimental proof of concept. Analytical and experimental demonstration concept of critical function and/or specification.
TRL/SRL 4 - Technology or solution validated in the laboratory/in the field. Test setup in the laboratory/in the field.
TRL/SRL 5 - Experimental development. Test set-up and technology or solution validated in operational environment.
TRL/SRL 6 - Technology/solution demonstrated in relevant environment.

Demonstration and pilot plants / Prototypes / Solution demonstrated
TRL/SRL 7 - System/solution prototype demonstrated in a development environment. Prototype in use.
TRL/SRL 8 - System/solution complete and qualified with proof of functionality in operational environment through testing and demonstration.

Implementation
TRL/SRL 9 - Qualified system/solution has been proven in the operational environment with evidence of successful use. Production under competitive conditions.
Which level (Technology Readiness Level, TRL, or Social Readiness Level, SRL) did your research have at the beginning of the funding by BRIDGE Discovery?

notAvailableChoiceText.text: TRL/SRL does not apply to my project / no answer
TRL does not apply to my project / I don't know

text.text: TRL/SRL does not apply to my project / no answer
What level of maturity was targeted or finally achieved at the end of the BRIDGE Discovery project ?
TRL at the start of the project cannot be higher than the TRL target or the TRL achieved. Please correct.
Environmental and social sustainability
Does the BRIDGE Discovery project lead to environmentally sustainable solutions?

hintText.text:
Environmental sustainability includes, for example, contributions regarding:

- Climate mitigation and adaptation 
- Renewable energy and energy efficiency 
- Sustainable mobility 
- Sustainable production and consumption, circular economy 
- Prevention of environmental pollution (waste, air, water) 
- Sustainable use of resources (raw materials, other materials) 
- Sustainable water management 
- Biodiversity and restoration of habitats (land and water) 
- Sustainable design of settlements and cities
- Creation of environmental benefits / reduction of environmental costs

placeholder.text: Bitte geben Sie hier Ihre Antwort ein.

text.text: Please describe the contribution to environmental sustainability in a few sentences:
Does the BRIDGE Discovery project lead to socially sustainable solutions?

hintText.text:
Social sustainability includes, for example, contributions relating to:

- Social cohesion (expanding soft and hard (public) infrastructure)
- Reducing gender and other inequalities in the population
- Social coexistence and participation
- Quality education
- Combating poverty
- Development promotion and cooperation
- Creation of social benefits / reduction of social costs

placeholder.text: Bitte geben Sie hier Ihre Antwort ein.

text.text: Please describe the contribution to social sustainability in a few sentences:
In your BRIDGE Discovery project, to what extent did your research focus on the development of digital technologies?

hintText.text:
Examples of digital technologies:

 - Cloud Computing, Cloud sourcing
- Virtual Reality, Augmented Reality
- Virtual Factory, Digital Twin
- Internet of Things (IoT)
- Artificial Intelligence (AI), Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Neural Networks
- Robotics
- Distributed Ledger Technologies (e.g. Blockchain)
- Quantum Computing

text.text: To what extent did your research focus on developing new digital business models?

hintText.text:
Examples of digital business models:

- Software as a Service SaaS / Platform as a Service PaaS 
- Infrastructure as a Service
- E-Commerce, Marketplace
- Digital Service Provider (On-Demand, Subscription, Freemium, etc.)
- Crowdsourcing and Crowdfunding
- Big Data business model

text.text: Multi-, inter- and trans-disciplinarity

Multi-disciplinary: Participation of different scientific fields or disciplines with specific knowledge and perspectives, each drawing on their disciplinary knowledge to contribute to the solution of the research problem

Inter-disciplinary: Collaboration of different scientific fields or disciplines to jointly find solutions or achieve results by integrating knowledge and methods from different disciplines, using a real synthesis of approaches

Trans-disciplinary: Collaboration from different scientific disciplines with additional participation of actors outside science (e.g. politics, society or other organisations or groups) to develop new ways of thinking or methods to change the system or the environment
How do you assess the BRIDGE Discovery project with regard to the integration of different disciplines ?
In-licensing (rights to use, develop, or commercialize intellectual property assets that are owned by another entity)
Out-licensing (granting another entity the rights to use, develop, or commercialize its own intellectual property assets)
What kind of intellectual property rights protection is being planned?

notAvailableChoiceText.text: No considerations on this so far

text.text: In-licensing (rights to use, develop or commercialise intellectual property owned by another organisation)
Out-licensing (granting rights to use, develop or commercialise one's own intellectual property to another organisation)
Have the results of the project led to property rights or are such rights planned?
Transfer office of your research organisation
What assistance have you used or plan on using to protect your intellectual property rights?
Achievements in the project

Research
Establishing a link between basic and application-oriented research
Developing academic career opportunities (e.g., PhD, Postdoc) for project staff
Using the research and project results in education and training

Research cooperation
Establishing cooperation with another research organisation or exploiting synergies

Knowledge and technology transfer
Strengthening the exchange between science and industry
Strengthening the exchange between science and the public sector
Strengthening the exchange between science and NGOs / non-profit organisations
(Steps towards) Foundation of a start-up/spin-off
Concretisation of a non-academic career / future employment for project staff

Implementation
Exchange of ideas with implementation partner
Collaboration with implementation partner in a project
Concrete plans to implement the results with an existing implementation partner / enterprise

Further achievements
Emergence of new research ideas outside the project.
Emergence of new innovation ideas outside the project
The objectives in the area of research were overall ...
The objectives in the area of application and implementation were overall ...
Have the following outcomes been achieved <u>at the end</u> of the BRIDGE Discovery project?

hintText.text:
Remark: Please rate on a scale between 1 and 6
1 = strongly disagree, 2 = disagree, 3 = rather disagree, 4 = rather agree, 5 = agree, 6 = strongly agree;
N/A: don‚Äôt know / no answer

text.text: Project development without BRIDGE funding
No, we would not have carried out the project
Yes, but likely to a much lesser extent
Yes, but likely to a slightly lesser extent
Yes, most likely to more or less the same extent
Would you have carried out the research idea of the BRIDGE Discovery project even without project funding of BRIDGE Discovery?
I would have looked for another funding opportunity

The project would have been realized more slowly

sections.name: Assessment of your BRIDGE Discovery project

text.text: Success of the BRIDGE Discovery project
Solving the application orientated research questions

How would you rate the benefits of the BRIDGE Discovery project in terms
of the following topics?
Overall success of the BRIDGE Discovery project
How successful do you think your BRIDGE Discovery project has been overall?
Overall, how satisfied are you with the BRIDGE Discovery funding programme?

hintText.text: Remark: Please evaluate the design and the implementation of the BRIDGE Discovery programme.

text.text: Support from the university/research institution (e.g., Research Office, Technology Transfer Office, etc.)
Specifically, how satisfied are you with the support you received during the project?
Would you like to comment on external support?
Where do you see room for improvement for BRIDGE Discovery? What do you think works very well?

This is the end of the survey, please submit.

Thank you for your time and your collaboration!

surveyEndText.text: Thank you very much for your participation. Your responses have been sent.
